CatDescriptText: Sallie Manson, 221 Third Street, Rankin, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 14, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think the recreational facilities for young people in Pittsburgh are adequate? If not, what do you think should be done about it?" answer reads: "I can't talk about Pittsburgh, but in Rankin, where I live, there are plenty of recreational facilities for the children."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Sallie Manson wearing light colored coat with dark button, and light colored patterned head scarf, posed in front of building with "office" sign
